meanings.def: a coin and unit of money worth 1% of the main unit of money in many countries, for example of the US dollar or of the euro
examples: A one-minute phone call to the UK cost 10 cents.
The price of diesel was increased by 17 cents per litre.
The $300 he'd spent on a ticket was worth every cent.
Not one cent of their profits goes to charity.
The delicious scent of freshly baked bread floated to his window.
I sent her a thank you letter.
Directors recommended a dividend of 60 cents per share.
The company offered its creditors 30 cents on the dollar (= 30 cents for every dollar it owed them).

meanings.def: to give your opinion about something, even if other people do not want to hear it

idioms.idiom: put in your two centsâ€™ worth
idioms.def: to give your opinion about something, even if other people do not want to hear it

related: give a hundred (and ten) per cent
